template.name: HP Comware HH3C by SNMP
template.description:
Template Net HP Comware (HH3C)
MIBs used: EtherLike-MIB HOST-RESOURCES-MIB SNMPv2-MIB ENTITY-MIB HH3C-ENTITY-EXT-MIB IF-MIB
Known Issues:
Description: No temperature sensors. All entities of them return 0 for HH3C-ENTITY-EXT-MIB::hh3cEntityExtTemperature Version: 1910-48 Switch Software Version 5.20.99, Release 1116 Copyright(c)2010-2016 Hewlett Packard Enterprise Development LP Device: HP 1910-48
Template tooling version used: 0.41

trigger.name: Unavailable by ICMP ping
trigger.description: Last three attempts returned timeout. Please check device connectivity.

trigger.expression: min(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)>{$ICMP_LOSS_WARN} and min(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)<100
trigger.name: High ICMP ping loss

dependency.name: High ICMP ping loss
dependency.expression: min(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)>{$ICMP_LOSS_WARN} and min(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)<100

item.name: SNMP traps (fallback)
item.description: The item is used to collect all SNMP traps unmatched by other snmptrap items

item.name: System contact details
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The textual identification of the contact person for this managed node, together with information on how to contact this person. If no contact information is known, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: System description
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB A textual description of the entity. This value should include the full name and version identification of the system's hardware type, software operating-system, and networking software.

item.name: Uptime (hardware)
item.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The amount of time since this host was last initialized. Note that this is different from sysUpTime in the SNMPv2-MIB [RFC1907] because sysUpTime is the uptime of the network management portion of the system.

item.name: System location
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The physical location of this node (e.g., `telephone closet, 3rd floor'). If the location is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: System name
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB An administratively-assigned name for this managed node.By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

trigger.expression: last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/system.name,#1)<>last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/system.name,#2) and length(last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/system.name))>0
trigger.name: System name has changed
trigger.description: System name has changed. Ack to close.

item.name: Uptime (network)
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The time (in hundredths of a second) since the network management portion of the system was last re-initialized.

item.name: System object ID
item.description: MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The vendor's authoritative identification of the network management subsystem contained in the entity. This value is allocated within the SMI enterprises subtree (1.3.6.1.4.1) and provides an easy and unambiguous means for determining`what kind of box' is being managed. For example, if vendor`Flintstones, Inc.' was assigned the subtree1.3.6.1.4.1.4242, it could assign the identifier 1.3.6.1.4.1.4242.1.1 to its `Fred Router'.

item.name: SNMP agent availability
item.description: Availability of SNMP checks on the host. The value of this item corresponds to availability icons in the host list. Possible value: 0 - not available 1 - available 2 - unknown

trigger.name: No SNMP data collection
trigger.description: SNMP is not available for polling. Please check device connectivity and SNMP settings.

item_prototype.name: {#ENT_NAME}: Firmware version
item_prototype.description: MIB: ENTITY-MIB

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/system.hw.firmware[entPhysicalFirmwareRev.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/system.hw.firmware[entPhysicalFirmwareRev.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2) and length(last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/system.hw.firmware[entPhysicalFirmwareRev.{#SNMPINDEX}]))>0
trigger_prototype.name: {#ENT_NAME}: Firmware has changed
trigger_prototype.description: Firmware version has changed. Ack to close

item_prototype.name: {#ENT_NAME}: Hardware model name
item_prototype.description: MIB: ENTITY-MIB

item_prototype.name: {#ENT_NAME}: Hardware serial number
item_prototype.description: MIB: ENTITY-MIB

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/system.hw.serialnumber[entPhysicalSerialNum.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/system.hw.serialnumber[entPhysicalSerialNum.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2) and length(last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/system.hw.serialnumber[entPhysicalSerialNum.{#SNMPINDEX}]))>0
trigger_prototype.name: {#ENT_NAME}: Device has been replaced
trigger_prototype.event_name: {#ENT_NAME}: Device has been replaced (new serial number received)
trigger_prototype.description: Device serial number has changed. Ack to close

item_prototype.name: {#ENT_NAME}: Hardware version(revision)
item_prototype.description: MIB: ENTITY-MIB

item_prototype.name: {#ENT_NAME}: Operating system
item_prototype.description: MIB: ENTITY-MIB

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/system.sw.os[entPhysicalSoftwareRev.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/system.sw.os[entPhysicalSoftwareRev.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2) and length(last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/system.sw.os[entPhysicalSoftwareRev.{#SNMPINDEX}]))>0
trigger_prototype.name: {#ENT_NAME}: Operating system description has changed
trigger_prototype.description: Operating system description has changed. Possible reasons that system has been updated or replaced. Ack to close.

dependency.name: System name has changed
dependency.expression: last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/system.name,#1)<>last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/system.name,#2) and length(last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/system.name))>0

discovery_rule.name: FAN Discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovering all entities of PhysicalClass - 7: fan(7)

item_prototype.name: {#ENT_NAME}: Fan status
item_prototype.description: MIB: HH3C-ENTITY-EXT-MIB Indicate the error state of this entity object. fanError(41) means that the fan stops working.

trigger_prototype.expression: count(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/sensor.fan.status[hh3cEntityExtErrorStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1,"eq","{$FAN_CRIT_STATUS:\"fanError\"}")=1 or count(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/sensor.fan.status[hh3cEntityExtErrorStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1,"eq","{$FAN_CRIT_STATUS:\"hardwareFaulty\"}")=1
trigger_prototype.name: {#ENT_NAME}: Fan is in critical state

discovery_rule.name: Module Discovery
discovery_rule.description: Filter limits results to 'Module level1' or Fabric Modules

item_prototype.name: {#MODULE_NAME}: CPU utilization
item_prototype.description: MIB: HH3C-ENTITY-EXT-MIB The CPU usage for this entity. Generally, the CPU usage will calculate the overall CPU usage on the entity, and it is not sensible with the number of CPU on the entity

trigger_prototype.name: {#MODULE_NAME}: High CPU utilization
trigger_prototype.description: CPU utilization is too high. The system might be slow to respond.

item_prototype.name: {#MODULE_NAME}: Memory utilization
item_prototype.description: MIB: HH3C-ENTITY-EXT-MIB The memory usage for the entity. This object indicates what percent of memory are used.

trigger_prototype.name: {#MODULE_NAME}: High memory utilization
trigger_prototype.description: The system is running out of free memory.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Inbound packets discarded
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of inbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Inbound packets with errors
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of inbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Bits received
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of octets received on the interface, including framing characters. This object is a 64-bit version of ifInOctets. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Outbound packets discarded
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Outbound packets with errors
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of outbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of outbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Bits sent
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of octets transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters. This object is a 64-bit version of ifOutOctets.Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Speed
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB An estimate of the interface's current bandwidth in units of 1,000,000 bits per second. If this object reports a value of `n' then the speed of the interface is somewhere in the range of `n-500,000' to`n+499,999'. For interfaces which do not vary in bandwidth or for those where no accurate estimation can be made, this object should contain the nominal bandwidth. For a sub-layer which has no concept of bandwidth, this object should be zero.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Operational status
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The current operational state of the interface. - The testing(3) state indicates that no operational packet scan be passed - If ifAdminStatus is down(2) then ifOperStatus should be down(2) - If ifAdminStatus is changed to up(1) then ifOperStatus should change to up(1) if the interface is ready to transmit and receive network traffic - It should change todormant(5) if the interface is waiting for external actions (such as a serial line waiting for an incoming connection) - It should remain in the down(2) state if and only if there is a fault that prevents it from going to the up(1) state - It should remain in the notPresent(6) state if the interface has missing(typically, hardware) components.

trigger_prototype.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and (last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2))
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
trigger_prototype.description:
This trigger expression works as follows: 1. Can be triggered if operations status is down. 2. {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down. 3. {TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1) - trigger fires only if operational status was up(1) sometime before. (So, do not fire 'ethernal off' interfaces.)
WARNING: if closed manually - won't fire again on next poll, because of .diff.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Interface type
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The type of interface. Additional values for ifType are assigned by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA), through updating the syntax of the IANAifType textual convention.

trigger_prototype.expression: change(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])<0 and last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])>0 and ( last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=6 or last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=7 or last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=11 or last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=62 or last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=69 or last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/net.if.type[ifType.{#SNMPINDEX}])=117 ) and (last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])<>2)
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: (change(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])>0 and last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2)>0) or (last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2)
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Ethernet has changed to lower speed than it was before
trigger_prototype.description: This Ethernet connection has transitioned down from its known maximum speed. This might be a sign of autonegotiation issues. Ack to close.

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and (last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2))

trigger_prototype.expression: (avg(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/net.if.in[ifHCInOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}],15m)>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}]) or avg(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/net.if.out[ifHCOutOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}],15m)>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])) and last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])>0
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: avg(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/net.if.in[ifHCInOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}],15m)<(({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}]) and avg(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/net.if.out[ifHCOutOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}],15m)<(({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}])
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High bandwidth usage
trigger_prototype.description: The network interface utilization is close to its estimated maximum bandwidth.

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and (last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2))

trigger_prototype.expression: min(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/net.if.in.errors[ifInErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}],5m)>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} or min(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/net.if.out.errors[ifOutErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}],5m)>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: max(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/net.if.in.errors[ifInErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}],5m)<{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}*0.8 and max(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/net.if.out.errors[ifOutErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}],5m)<{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}*0.8
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High error rate

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}])=2 and (last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2))

discovery_rule.name: EtherLike-MIB Discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovering interfaces from IF-MIB and EtherLike-MIB. Interfaces with up(1) Operational Status are discovered.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Duplex status
item_prototype.description:
MIB: EtherLike-MIB The current mode of operation of the MAC entity. 'unknown' indicates that the current duplex mode could not be determined.
Management control of the duplex mode is accomplished through the MAU MIB. When an interface does not support autonegotiation, or when autonegotiation is not enabled, the duplex mode is controlled using ifMauDefaultType. When autonegotiation is supported and enabled, duplex mode is controlled using ifMauAutoNegAdvertisedBits. In either case, the currently operating duplex mode is reflected both in this object and in ifMauType.
Note that this object provides redundant information with ifMauType. Normally, redundant objects are discouraged. However, in this instance, it allows a management application to determine the duplex status of an interface without having to know every possible value of ifMauType. This was felt to be sufficiently valuable to justify the redundancy. Reference: [IEEE 802.3 Std.], 30.3.1.1.32,aDuplexStatus.

trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): In half-duplex mode
trigger_prototype.description: Please check autonegotiation settings and cabling

discovery_rule.name: PSU Discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovering all entities of PhysicalClass - 6: powerSupply(6)

item_prototype.name: {#ENT_NAME}: Power supply status
item_prototype.description: MIB: HH3C-ENTITY-EXT-MIB Indicate the error state of this entity object. psuError(51) means that the Power Supply Unit is in the state of fault. rpsError(61) means the Redundant Power Supply is in the state of fault.

trigger_prototype.expression: count(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/sensor.psu.status[hh3cEntityExtErrorStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1,"eq","{$PSU_CRIT_STATUS:\"psuError\"}")=1 or count(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/sensor.psu.status[hh3cEntityExtErrorStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1,"eq","{$PSU_CRIT_STATUS:\"rpsError\"}")=1 or count(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/sensor.psu.status[hh3cEntityExtErrorStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1,"eq","{$PSU_CRIT_STATUS:\"hardwareFaulty\"}")=1
trigger_prototype.name: {#ENT_NAME}: Power supply is in critical state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the power supply unit for errors

discovery_rule.name: Temperature Discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovering modules temperature (same filter as in Module Discovery) plus and temperature sensors

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Temperature
item_prototype.description: MIB: HH3C-ENTITY-EXT-MIB The temperature for the {#SNMPVALUE}.

trigger_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Temperature is above critical threshold
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

trigger_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Temperature is above warning threshold
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

macro.description: Filter out loopbacks, nulls, docker veth links and docker0 bridge by default

trigger.expression: (last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/system.hw.uptime[hrSystemUptime.0])>0 and last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/system.hw.uptime[hrSystemUptime.0])<10m) or (last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/system.hw.uptime[hrSystemUptime.0])=0 and last(/HP Comware HH3C by SNMP/system.net.uptime[sysUpTime.0])<10m)
trigger.name: Host has been restarted
